page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: This area consists almost entirely of the flat wetlands of Street and Walton Moors, which are used almost entirely for pasture for dairy herds. To the north there is a well-defined ridge (Walton and Ivythorn Hill) from which extensive views may be enjoyed to the south and north. Much of this ridge is the property of the National Trust. Nestling beneath its dip slope are a handful of farms which comprise the total population of the block with the exception of part of the village of Dundon situated on highland to the south-west. No roads traverse the block and communication is made more arduous by the drainage ditches surrounding each field on the wetlands. There are three "Decoy Pools" situated here. There is no industry or community centre(save for Dundon Church) in the block.
